medical_history.chief_complaint: Global developmental delay in a 10-month-old boy
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms included failure to roll over or sit alone, absence of teeth eruption, and ability to only make monosyllabic sounds. Weight gain issues were noted, with significant weight loss after birth and eventually improved weight gain after switching feeding formulas. Developmental milestones like raising head and sitting unsupported were significantly delayed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born with muscular hypotonia, no long-term feeding requirements, and hospitalization due to weak cry, poor spirit, and neonatal jaundice. Notable events include a cesarean delivery due to abnormal fetal conditions.
medical_history.social_history: The mother had no history of smoking, alcohol consumption, or drug use during pregnancy. The parents are non-consanguineous and healthy.
